intro: Vellozia squalida, commonly known as the rough vellozia, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its unique, wiry stems and dense clusters of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or brown in color. Vellozia squalida is adapted to arid environments, showcasing succulent features that help it store water. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in regions with low rainfall.
